TopicTitle: Maxmaps Offers a Sneak Peek at Kerbal Space Program: Asteroid Redirect Mission

Articles.Content:
<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/nfRe0696vZM" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p><strong>Squad</strong> has released a playthrough of the upcoming <strong><em>Asteroid Redirect Mission</em></strong> patch for <em><strong>Kerbal Space Program</strong></em>, the award-winning indie space agency sim game for PC, Mac and Linux. Watch as <strong>Maxmaps</strong> takes players through a sneak peek of some the biggest features in this collaboration with <strong>NASA</strong>.</p>

Edited March 31, 2014 by KasperVld
Well...I can't freaking wait

How come this is called "playthrough"?

That rendezvous module (which is different from the one that was sent into space at the beginning) is so weird. 8 engines with that small amount of fuel, trying to move an asteroid that big? I sense cheating.
Plz stop teasing us

How come this is called "playthrough"?

That rendezvous module (which is different from the one that was sent into space at the beginning) is so weird. 8 engines with that small amount of fuel, trying to move an asteroid that big? I sense cheating.

It may have been, it might not have been. He may have only needed like 100m/s or so to capture it, if the orbit was good enough.
I don't want to hear about 0.23.5 . I want it. NOW!!! (no seriously take your time to fix the bugs and stuff. I don't want a buggy patch, so do what you do best. Make a kickass space sim! )
When though!

I am inclined to believe that if it isn't released today, the soonest we may see it is Tuesday -- at least if we're going by historical releases it seems like it only happens on Tuesday, Wednesday or Thursday.

I disagree, all this teasing is giving it huge hype. I, for one, am extremely excited by this pack and like the tension and anticipation of finding out when you get home if it has or hasn't been released yet.
